recipe.name: Spaghetti with Fried Eggs and Pangrattato for One
recipe.description: A simple yet luxurious dish of spaghetti topped with runny fried eggs, garlic, capers, and crunchy pangrattato (breadcrumbs). Perfect for a solo dinner that's both comforting and quick.
steps: Cook spaghetti in a pot of salted water until al dente. Drain, reserving some of the cooking liquid.
In a pan, heat olive oil and butter. Add garlic and fry the eggs, ensuring the whites set while the yolks remain runny.
Toss the cooked pasta with the fried eggs, parsley, capers, and garlic. Add some of the reserved cooking water for a creamier consistency if needed.
Serve the pasta with grated Pecorino Romano and top with crunchy pangrattato.

recipe.name: Classic Chicken Piccata
recipe.description: A classic Italian-American dish featuring tender chicken breast cutlets cooked in a zesty lemon-butter caper sauce. This light and flavorful dish is perfect for a quick weeknight meal or a special occasion.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Boneless, skinless chicken breasts, trimmed and pounded until 1/4 inch thick
Couscous or angel hair pasta (for serving)

steps: Cut one lemon in half lengthwise. Trim the ends from one half and cut across into thin slices about 1/8 inch thick; set aside. Juice the remaining half and whole lemon to obtain about 1/4 cup juice; set aside.
Season both sides of the chicken breasts generously with salt and pepper. Place flour into a shallow dish or pan. Coat each breast with flour, and shake to remove excess.

Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large, heavy-bottomed skillet over medium-high heat until hot, about 2 minutes. Cook half the batch in the skillet without moving them until lightly browned on the first side, 2 to 2 1/2 minutes. Turn and cook until the second side is lightly browned, 2 to 2 1/2 minutes longer. Transfer to a plate kept warm in the oven, or cover with aluminum foil. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil to the skillet and heat until shimmering. Add remaining chicken pieces and repeat. Add cooked chicken to previous batch and keep warm in 200-degree oven.

Using the pan in which you cooked the chicken, saut√© the shallots in the oil and browned bits remaining in the pan. Once shallots become translucent, add the chicken broth and lemon slices. Allow to cook until lemon slices are well-softened.

Add the capers and lemon juice, and allow to reduce to concentrate flavors. Remove pan from heat and swirl in the butter until it melts and thickens the sauce. Swirl in the parsley. Spoon over chicken and serve immediately over a bed of couscous or angel hair pasta.

recipe.name: Chickpea, Pumpkin, and Sage Stew
recipe.description: A hearty and comforting one-dish meal featuring chickpeas, pumpkin puree, and fresh sage. This cozy autumnal stew is easy to prepare with pantry staples and is perfect for chilly evenings.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Ditalini, tubetti, or other small pasta like orzo

steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped carrot, onion, and sage leaves. Saut√© until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the chickpeas, pumpkin puree, and chicken broth. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer.
Add the pasta and cook until tender, about 10-12 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with a drizzle of olive oil on top.

recipe.name: Double Chocolate Espresso Cookies
recipe.description: Rich and decadent chocolate cookies with a kick of espresso, perfect for grown-ups and special occasions. Crisp on the edges and chewy in the middle, these cookies are best enjoyed with a glass of milk.
steps: Preheat oven to 350¬∞ F.
Cream butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Then, add eggs one at a time, mixing after each addition.
In a separate bowl, mix together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, salt, and espresso powder.
With the mixer on low, slowly add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Stir in chocolate chips.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Drop dough by rounded teaspoon onto the sheet 2 inches apart. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

recipe.name: Gochujang-Yogurt Chicken with Garlic Butter Rice
recipe.description: A tangy, spicy chicken dish with creamy garlic butter rice, combining gochujang-marinated chicken with savory garlic rice for a perfect, flavorful meal.
steps: In a bowl, combine the gochujang, yogurt, and 3 cloves of minced garlic. Add the chicken thighs and toss to coat. Let marinate for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight.

In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the remaining clove of minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the rice and cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes until lightly toasted.
Pour in the chicken stock, bring to a simmer, then cover and reduce heat to low. Cook until the rice is tender, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let sit, covered, for 10 minutes.

Preheat the broiler and set a rack 6 inches from the heat. Line a baking sheet with foil and set a wire rack on top. Remove the chicken from the marinade and place on the rack. Broil for 5 to 7 minutes per side, until charred and cooked through.
In a small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise and lemon juice. Thin with a little water, if needed, to reach a drizzly consistency.
To serve, divide the rice among plates. Top with lettuce leaves, cherry tomatoes, and the broiled chicken. Drizzle with the lemon-mayo sauce.

recipe.name: Simple Cheese Souffl√©
recipe.description: An easy, light, and flavorful cheese souffl√© made with Gruy√®re, perfect for a mid-week family meal. This unfussy dish is best served with a simple green salad for an elegant yet simple lunch or dinner.
steps: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F. Butter a 7" souffl√© dish and coat it with grated Parmesan cheese.
Whip egg whites with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form. In another bowl, beat the egg yolks until smooth.
Melt butter over low heat, add flour, and whisk to blend. Add milk and cook, stirring constantly, until thick and smooth.
Remove from heat and stir in the cheese and egg yolks. Fold in the stiff egg whites carefully.
Pour the mixture into the buttered souffl√© dish and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the souffl√© is puffed and golden. Serve immediately.

recipe.name: Stir-Fried Udon with Bacon, Parmesan & Gochujang
recipe.description: A fusion dish combining elements from Korean, Japanese, and Italian cuisines. This stir-fried udon features thick-cut bacon, gochujang, Parmesan, and egg yolks for a savory, spicy, and creamy pasta experience.
steps: Bring a medium pot of water to a boil for the udon.
In a skillet, heat oil over medium-low heat. Add the bacon, scallions, garlic, and a pinch of salt. Saute until the bacon is golden brown.
In a mixing bowl, whisk the egg yolks, Parmesan, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
Lower the skillet heat, add soy sauce and gochujang, and stir to coat the bacon mixture.
Cook the udon noodles according to the package instructions. Drain and add the noodles to the skillet. Toss to combine with the bacon and gochujang sauce.
Mix 2-3 tablespoons of the reserved udon water into the egg-cheese mixture to form a sauce. Add the udon and toss to coat.
Season with more salt and pepper if needed, drizzle with sesame oil, and serve garnished with scallions.

recipe.name: Best Korean Fried Chicken
recipe.description: Crispy and flavorful Korean fried chicken with a soy garlic sauce. The chicken is double-fried to perfection, offering extra crunch, and tossed in a sweet, spicy, and savory glaze.
steps: In a large bowl, mix the chicken pieces with salt and black pepper. Transfer to a large zip-top bag, add potato starch, and shake to coat the chicken evenly.
Heat 2 inches of vegetable oil in a deep pan to 340¬∞F. Fry the chicken in batches for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until golden brown. Drain on a rack or strainer.
Return the oil to 340¬∞F and re-fry the chicken for an additional 10-13 minutes until crispy. Drain again.
To make the sauce, heat oil in a pan, add chiles, garlic, and ginger, cooking until fragrant. Stir in soy sauce, rice syrup, vinegar, and brown sugar, simmering until thickened.
Toss the fried chicken in the sauce, sprinkle with sesame seeds, and serve.

recipe.name: Orzo Salad with Green Beans, Tomatoes, Feta & Mint
recipe.description: A bright, Mediterranean-inspired orzo salad with blistered green beans, burst tomatoes, creamy feta, and fresh mint, brought together with a touch of soy sauce for extra umami. Perfect as a side dish or a light meal.
steps: Boil a pot of salted water, add orzo, and cook until al dente, about 8 minutes. Drain and drizzle with olive oil. Set aside.

In a skillet, heat oil over medium-high. Add green beans, season with salt, and let them blister for about 3 minutes. Add the tomatoes and red pepper flakes, cooking until the tomatoes burst, about 5 more minutes.
Add soy sauce, then stir in the cooked orzo, lemon juice, and half of the feta. Let the feta melt slightly into the orzo.
Take the skillet off the heat, garnish with the remaining feta and fresh mint, and season with black pepper to taste. Serve warm or cold.

recipe.name: Ven Pongal (South Indian Rice & Lentil Dish)
recipe.description: A comforting South Indian dish made with rice and mung dal, flavored with black pepper, cumin, ghee, and cashews. Pongal is a popular breakfast staple often served with coconut chutney and sambar.
steps: Wash the rice in several changes of water until clear. Soak for 30 minutes, then drain.
In a pot over medium heat, dry roast the lentils for 2-3 minutes until golden and nutty. Wash them thoroughly.
Combine the rice, lentils, and 3¬Ω cups of water in a pot. Add ginger, turmeric, and 2 tablespoons of ghee. Bring to a boil, skim off foam, then cook over low heat for 20 minutes.
Add another ¬Ω cup of water and cook for 5 more minutes until creamy. Mash slightly to achieve a risotto-like texture.
Meanwhile, fry cashews in ghee until golden and set aside.
In the same pan, add cumin, pepper, and asafoetida to the remaining ghee, frying until fragrant. Pour this over the rice mixture.
Mix in coconut, salt, and the fried cashews, reserving some for garnish. Serve hot.

recipe.name: Roasted Tomato BLT Soup
recipe.description: A unique blend of roasted tomatoes, bacon, and fresh greens, this soup brings together the flavors of a classic BLT sandwich in a bowl. Topped with croutons, arugula, and a garlic mayonnaise drizzle, it‚Äôs perfect for any season and can be served hot, warm, or chilled.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Red wine vinegar or lemon juice

steps: Preheat the oven to 375¬∞F. Halve or quarter the tomatoes and arrange on a baking sheet with the onions, garlic, and oregano. Drizzle with olive oil, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and roast for 45 minutes, basting occasionally.

Cool the roasted vegetables slightly, peel the tomato skins if desired, and transfer the vegetables and juices to a large pot. Add chicken stock, sugar, red pepper flakes, vinegar, and basil. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Pur√©e the soup using an immersion blender until smooth. Adjust seasoning as needed.
Meanwhile, fry the diced bacon until crispy and set aside. Make the croutons by tossing the bread cubes with olive oil and toasting in the oven until golden.
Prepare the garlic mayonnaise by mashing two of the roasted garlic cloves and mixing with the mayonnaise.
Serve the soup with bacon bits, croutons, arugula, and a drizzle of garlic mayonnaise.

recipe.name: Northern Spy's Kale Salad
recipe.description: A hearty kale salad with roasted squash, almonds, aged cheddar, and lemon dressing, this dish brings together bold flavors and textures. Perfect for a fall meal or a refreshing side.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Kale (lacinato or dinosaur), ribs removed and finely sliced

steps: Preheat oven to 425¬∞F. Toss the squash cubes with olive oil, salt, and pepper, and roast on a baking sheet for about 40 minutes, turning occasionally until tender and caramelized.
In a large bowl, toss the kale with the roasted squash, almonds, and cheddar. Dress with lemon juice and a drizzle of olive oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Top with shaved pecorino if desired, and serve.

recipe.name: Honey-Mustard Chicken with Raw Corn Panzanella
recipe.description: A juicy baked honey-mustard chicken breast served with a fresh corn panzanella salad featuring sourdough, tomatoes, and a tangy dressing.
steps: Preheat your oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C).
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, Dijon mustard, honey, thyme, mustard powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper to make the marinade.
Place the chicken breast in a shallow dish and pour half of the marinade over it, turning the chicken to coat evenly. Let it marinate for 10-15 minutes.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of oil and sear the marinated chicken breast on each side for about 3 minutes, until golden brown.

Transfer the seared chicken to an oven-safe dish, pour any remaining marinade from the skillet over it, and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165¬∞F (74¬∞C). Remove from the oven and let it rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
While the chicken is baking, prepare the Panzanella. Cut the sourdough bread into cubes, then toast them in a dry skillet over medium heat until they are golden and crisp, about 5 minutes.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the corn kernels, halved grape tomatoes, grated garlic, and toasted sourdough bread cubes.
Pour the remaining half of the marinade over the corn and bread mixture, tossing gently to coat everything evenly.
To serve, place the corn Panzanella on a plate, then slice the chicken and arrange it on top. Drizzle any extra pan juices over the chicken, if desired, and enjoy!

recipe.name: Risotto alla Carbonara
recipe.description: A creamy, indulgent risotto inspired by classic pasta carbonara, featuring guanciale, egg yolk, and Pecorino Romano.
steps: Starting from a cold pan, heat the guanciale in olive oil until crisp, about 5 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, saut√© shallots, then add rice and toast for 1 minute. Add vermouth and reduce completely.
Slowly add hot chicken broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring until absorbed, about 16 minutes. Check if rice is al dente.
In a small bowl, whisk together egg yolk, cream, pepper, and cheese.
Fold the egg mixture into the risotto, mixing until creamy. Top with guanciale, Pecorino shavings, and black pepper.

recipe.name: Best Tuna Salad
recipe.description: A classic tuna salad made with solid white albacore tuna, creamy mayonnaise, lemon juice, and a dash of fish sauce for extra umami. Perfect for sandwiches or as a dip.

ingredients.ingredient_name: solid white albacore tuna in oil, drained

steps: In a large mixing bowl, add all ingredients and stir until the mayonnaise is fully incorporated.
Taste and adjust with more salt, lemon juice, or mustard as needed.
Serve immediately or store in the fridge for up to 3 days. Garnish with fresh herbs if desired.

recipe.name: Pasta with Creamy Cherry Tomato Sauce
recipe.description: A simple, creamy pasta dish featuring charred cherry tomatoes, garlic, and anchovies, finished with fresh herbs. Perfect for a summery weeknight meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: short-shaped pasta (such as penne, fusilli, or cavatappi)

steps: Set a large pot of water to boil. Season with salt when it starts to simmer.
In a large skillet over medium-high heat, warm olive oil. Add tomatoes, season with salt, and cook for about 5 minutes until tomatoes char and release juices.
Add anchovies, garlic, and red pepper flakes to the skillet. Stir and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in the half-and-half, reduce heat to medium, and simmer for 5-10 minutes until sauce thickens.
Cook pasta until al dente. Drain and add pasta to the sauce, tossing to coat. Adjust salt and red pepper if needed.
Serve hot, topped with fresh herbs.

recipe.name: Caramelized Kimchi Patty Melt
recipe.description: A bold twist on the classic patty melt featuring spicy caramelized kimchi, juicy beef patties, and Pepper Jack cheese, all sandwiched between perfectly toasted rye bread.

ingredients.ingredient_name: ripe kimchi, drained and roughly chopped

steps: In a small skillet, melt butter over medium-low heat. Add chopped kimchi and sugar, cooking for 4-5 minutes until the liquid evaporates and the kimchi is caramelized. Set aside.

In a large bowl, mix ground beef with Worcestershire sauce until combined. Divide into 4 portions, shape into oblong patties (matching the size of the bread), and flatten. Season both sides with salt and pepper.
Heat 1 tsp oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook patties in batches for 1-2 minutes per side, until browned but still juicy. Remove from skillet.

Spread mayonnaise on one side of each bread slice. Place 2 slices in the skillet, mayo-side down. Add a slice of cheese, a beef patty, a portion of caramelized kimchi, another slice of cheese, and a second slice of bread (mayo-side up).

Cook over medium-low heat, pressing gently with a spatula or burger press, for 1-2 minutes until the bread is toasted and the cheese starts to melt. Sprinkle with garlic salt on the top slice if desired. Flip and repeat on the other side.
Cut sandwiches in half diagonally and serve immediately, optionally with a cold dill pickle.

recipe.name: Islander Lively Bowl With Pineapple Salsa
recipe.description: A vibrant grain bowl with smoky mushrooms, sweet pineapple salsa, creamy cilantro aioli, and fresh toppings, inspired by Caribbean flavors.
steps: In a medium bowl, mix pineapple, cilantro, red onion, tomatoes, jalape√±o, and lime juice. Season with salt and black pepper. Cover and refrigerate.
In a large bowl, whisk tamari, sesame oil, maple syrup, and sriracha. Add shiitake mushrooms, tossing to coat. Marinate for at least 20 minutes.
Blend vegan mayo, olive oil, lime juice, cilantro, garlic, lime zest, cumin, salt, and black pepper until smooth. Refrigerate until serving.
Drain mushrooms and heat coconut oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and cook until crispy, about 5 minutes per side.
Assemble bowls with brown rice, mushrooms, pineapple salsa, and a dollop of aioli. Garnish with avocado slices and pickled red onions, if desired.

recipe.name: Bell-less, Whistle-less, Damn Good French Toast
recipe.description: A simple and delicious French toast recipe made with challah bread, eggs, heavy cream, and butter, resulting in a rich, custardy interior and a slightly crisp exterior.
steps: In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs and heavy cream until smooth.
Heat a nonstick pan over medium heat and melt the butter.
Dip each slice of challah bread into the egg mixture, ensuring it is fully coated but not soggy.
Cook the bread slices in the pan for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and slightly crisp.
Serve warm with maple syrup or your favorite toppings.

recipe.name: Black Pepper Popovers with Chives and Parmesan
recipe.description: Delicate and savory popovers infused with fresh chives, Parmesan cheese, and a hint of black pepper, perfect for any meal.
steps: Heat the oven to 450¬∞F. Lightly coat a 12-cup popover pan or muffin tin with melted butter or oil.
Whisk together the milk, eggs, and melted butter in a large bowl until blended. Add the flour, salt, black pepper, Parmesan cheese, chives, and lemon zest; mix well.

Place the empty pan in the oven to heat for 7 minutes. Carefully remove from the oven and fill the cups evenly with the batter (transferring the batter to a 4-cup liquid measuring cup can make this less messy).
Bake for 18-20 minutes, then lower the oven temperature to 350¬∞F. Continue baking until the popovers are deep golden brown, about 15-18 more minutes.
Cool briefly in the pan before removing and serving. To reheat cooled popovers, place them in a 350¬∞F oven for about 5 minutes.

recipe.name: Cinnamon Sugar Breakfast Puffs
recipe.description: A delightful hybrid of spice cake, muffins, and cinnamon sugar donut holes, offering a cakey and light texture with crisp edges and a crunchy cinnamon sugar coating.
steps: In a heavy-bottomed pan, heat the 1/3 cup butter over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, until browned and nutty smelling. Pour into a mixing bowl and allow to cool completely to room temperature.
Preheat your oven to 350¬∞F. Grease and lightly flour a 12-cup muffin tin.
Add the sugar and egg to the cooled butter. Beat with an electric mixer until all creamed together, lightened in color, and fluffy (about 5 minutes).
In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, salt, spices, and orange zest.
Add the dry ingredients in increments to the butter-sugar mixture, alternating with the milk and beating until fully combined after each addition.
Divide the batter evenly into the cups of the muffin tin. Bake until golden brown and fragrant, about 20-25 minutes.
While the puffs are baking, put the melted butter in one shallow bowl and combine the sugar and cinnamon in another.

When the puffs come out of the oven, use a knife to gently pop them all out of the muffin tin. One by one, dip each puff in the melted butter‚Äîget it all over it‚Äîthen roll it in the cinnamon sugar. Transfer to a serving platter and continue until all puffs are coated. Serve warm.

recipe.name: Aretha Frankenstein's Waffles of Insane Greatness
recipe.description: A morning-of alternative to overnight yeasted waffles, these feature cornstarch in the batter for a silky, moist interior and a thin, crisp crust.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Whole milk or buttermilk (or a combination)
Butter and pure maple syrup, for serving

steps: In a medium bowl, combine the flour, cornstarch, baking powder, baking soda, and salt; mix well.
Add the milk, vegetable oil, egg, sugar, and vanilla; mix well.
Let the batter sit for 30 minutes.
Heat a waffle iron. Follow the directions on your waffle iron to cook the waffles.
Serve immediately with butter and pure maple syrup, or hold in a 200¬∞F oven, directly on the rack (don't stack them or they'll get soggy). These also reheat very well in the toaster.

recipe.name: Lemony Cream Cheese Pancakes with Blueberries
recipe.description: Light and custardy pancakes infused with lemon zest and juice, featuring creamy pockets of cream cheese and bursts of blueberries, perfect for a delightful breakfast.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Cream cheese, cut into small cubes
Butter or cooking spray, for cooking

steps: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk together the milk, eggs, lemon zest, and lemon juice.
Gently fold the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients, being careful not to overmix. Fold in the cream cheese cubes and blueberries.
Heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and grease with butter or cooking spray.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter per pancake onto the skillet. Cook until bubbles form on the surface, about 2-3 minutes, then flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes until golden brown.
Serve warm with maple syrup, if desired.

recipe.name: Spaghetti with Fried Eggs and Pangrattato for One
recipe.description: A simple yet luxurious dish of spaghetti topped with runny fried eggs, garlic, capers, and crunchy pangrattato (breadcrumbs). Perfect for a solo dinner that's both comforting and quick.
steps: Cook spaghetti in a pot of salted water until al dente. Drain, reserving some of the cooking liquid.
In a pan, heat olive oil and butter. Add garlic and fry the eggs, ensuring the whites set while the yolks remain runny.
Toss the cooked pasta with the fried eggs, parsley, capers, and garlic. Add some of the reserved cooking water for a creamier consistency if needed.
Serve the pasta with grated Pecorino Romano and top with crunchy pangrattato.

recipe.name: Brothy Tomato Pasta with White Fish, Shallots & Capers
recipe.description: A light, brothy pasta with cherry tomatoes, white fish, and a crispy caper topping. Perfect for a fresh, seaside-inspired meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: colatura di alici or fish sauce (optional)
mezzi paccheri or other tubular pasta
skinless white fish (e.g., Pollock), cut into 2-inch pieces

steps: For the topping, heat ¬º cup of olive oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and shallots, cooking until browned, about 5 minutes. Add capers, cook 1 minute, then stir in 1 tbsp parsley and red pepper flakes. Set aside.
In a large saut√© pan over medium heat, warm 2 tbsp olive oil. Add tomatoes, salt, and pepper, cooking until softened, 8-10 minutes.
Add tomato paste, cooking 1 minute. Deglaze with wine, if using, and reduce by half, 3-5 minutes. Add 2 cups of water, simmer for 10 minutes, then add fish sauce to taste.
Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pasta until just shy of al dente.
Season fish with salt and pepper, add to the broth, and cook over low heat for 4 minutes, flipping once.
Add pasta to the pan, stirring to combine with the broth and breaking up the fish into flakes. Simmer for 1-2 minutes.
Serve pasta with caper topping, remaining parsley, and lemon wedges.

recipe.name: Pasta with Creamy Cherry Tomato Sauce
recipe.description: A simple, creamy pasta dish featuring charred cherry tomatoes, garlic, and anchovies, finished with fresh herbs. Perfect for a summery weeknight meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: short-shaped pasta (such as penne, fusilli, or cavatappi)

steps: Set a large pot of water to boil. Season with salt when it starts to simmer.
In a large skillet over medium-high heat, warm olive oil. Add tomatoes, season with salt, and cook for about 5 minutes until tomatoes char and release juices.
Add anchovies, garlic, and red pepper flakes to the skillet. Stir and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in the half-and-half, reduce heat to medium, and simmer for 5-10 minutes until sauce thickens.
Cook pasta until al dente. Drain and add pasta to the sauce, tossing to coat. Adjust salt and red pepper if needed.
Serve hot, topped with fresh herbs.

recipe.name: Mandilli de Sea With Sugo Finto & Parmesan Crisps
recipe.description: A luxurious pasta dish with delicate handkerchief pasta (mandilli de sea) served with a savory vegetarian 'meat' sauce (sugo finto) and crisp Parmesan.

ingredients.ingredient_name: fennel bulb or large carrot, finely chopped

steps: In a saucepan, melt half the butter over medium heat and add the meat substitute. Cook, stirring, until browned, about 5-7 minutes. Transfer to a bowl.
In the same pan, melt remaining butter, add chopped vegetables with a pinch of salt, and cook until soft, about 10 minutes.
Add garlic and cook briefly. Stir in tomato and miso pastes, cooking until tomato paste darkens, about 2 minutes. Return meat to pan.
Add red wine and Worcestershire sauce, simmer for 1-2 minutes. Add vegetable stock, cover, and simmer for 1 hour.
Add milk, stir, and continue simmering for 45 minutes. Season to taste.
For the pasta, mix flours and eggs until smooth, knead, then rest for 30 minutes. Roll thin, cut into large squares.
For Parmesan crisps, bake grated cheese in a thin layer at 400¬∞F for 5-7 minutes until golden.
Serve pasta with sauce and Parmesan crisps.

recipe.name: Vegan Pasta al Limone(ish)
recipe.description: A creamy, tangy pasta made with a cashew-based sauce, lemon juice, and nutritional yeast, perfect for a light and flavorful vegan meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: raw cashews, soaked in hot water
flaky salt, red chile flakes, and additional lemon zest

steps: Cook pasta in salted boiling water until al dente. Reserve 1 cup of pasta water and drain.

In a blender, combine soaked cashews, lemon peel and juice, olive oil, nutritional yeast, salt, pepper, and 1/3 cup of reserved pasta water. Blend until smooth, adding more water to achieve desired consistency.
Return pasta to pot, add sauce, and toss to coat. Thin with additional pasta water if needed. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Serve with flaky salt, red chile flakes, and additional lemon zest on top.

recipe.name: Squash & Brown Butter Tortelli With Brussels Sprouts & Balsamic
recipe.description: A luxurious handmade tortelli pasta filled with creamy squash, served with nutty Brussels sprouts and a tangy balsamic reduction for a perfect autumnal dish.
steps: Preheat oven to 375¬∞F and roast the squash with olive oil, salt, and pepper until tender, about 45 minutes.
Make brown butter by cooking butter until golden and nutty. Reserve 50g for the filling.
Reduce balsamic vinegar over medium-low heat until thickened to a syrupy consistency. Set aside.
Prepare the pasta dough by mixing flours and eggs, knead until smooth, and let rest for 30 minutes.
Blend roasted squash with brown butter, cheeses, nutmeg, salt, and pepper until creamy. Refrigerate the filling.
Roll out pasta dough, cut into squares, and fill with squash mixture. Seal and shape tortelli.
Cook Brussels sprouts in butter until golden and slightly crispy. Set aside.
Boil tortelli, toss with reserved brown butter, and plate with Brussels sprouts and balsamic reduction.

recipe.name: Vicky Bennison's 'Cupboard Is Bare' Pasta & Chickpeas
recipe.description: A simple and satisfying pasta dish made with pantry staples like canned chickpeas, garlic, and rosemary, finished with Parmigiano for a quick and delicious meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: good-quality pasta (e.g., fusilli lungi, penne, or orecchiette)

steps: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil and cook the pasta according to package instructions.
Meanwhile, heat a generous drizzle of olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook gently until softened but not browned.
Add the drained chickpeas to the pan and stir well. Use the back of a spoon to crush about half of the chickpeas for a creamier texture.
Stir in the minced rosemary and a pinch of cayenne pepper. Add a ladleful of the starchy pasta cooking water and let it simmer for about a minute.
Drain the pasta and toss it in the pan with the chickpea mixture. Mix well to coat the pasta.
Serve immediately, topped with grated Parmigiano.

recipe.name: Cornbread Strata with Cheddar & Jalape√±os
recipe.description: A savory strata with cornbread, sharp cheddar, jalape√±os, and scallions. Perfect for breakfast or brunch with a spicy kick.
steps: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Grease a high-sided baking dish with 1 tbsp butter.
Spread cubed cornbread on a baking sheet. Melt remaining butter and pour over cornbread, sprinkle smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. Toss to coat and toast for 10-12 minutes.
In a large bowl, whisk eggs, then add milk, salt, and pepper. Reserve a small amount of scallions for garnish.
Add corn, jalape√±os, remaining scallions, grated garlic, and most of the cheese to the bowl. Stir to combine.
Fold in toasted cornbread, ensuring all pieces are moistened. Transfer mixture to the baking dish, garnish with remaining cheese.
Bake for 45 minutes until golden and set. Let cool slightly before serving with yogurt or sour cream.

recipe.name: Crunchy-Shell Cauliflower Tacos
recipe.description: Inspired by classic ground-beef tacos, these vegetarian tacos feature roasted cauliflower in crispy shells, with toppings like shredded lettuce and pepper jack cheese.
steps: Preheat the oven to 450¬∞F and line two sheet pans with silicone mats or parchment paper.
Remove the bottom of the cauliflower stem and leaves, then roughly chop. Process in two batches until almost riced, with a few chunks remaining.
Spread cauliflower evenly on both sheet pans. Toss with olive oil, chili powder, and salt, then spread out for even roasting.
Roast for about 20 minutes, rotating pans halfway through for even browning.
While the cauliflower roasts, warm the taco shells in the oven until crisp, about 2 minutes.
Assemble tacos by layering cauliflower, lettuce, and cheese in each shell.

recipe.name: Squash & Brown Butter Tortelli With Brussels Sprouts & Balsamic
recipe.description: A luxurious handmade tortelli pasta filled with creamy squash, served with nutty Brussels sprouts and a tangy balsamic reduction for a perfect autumnal dish.
steps: Preheat oven to 375¬∞F and roast the squash with olive oil, salt, and pepper until tender, about 45 minutes.
Make brown butter by cooking butter until golden and nutty. Reserve 50g for the filling.
Reduce balsamic vinegar over medium-low heat until thickened to a syrupy consistency. Set aside.
Prepare the pasta dough by mixing flours and eggs, knead until smooth, and let rest for 30 minutes.
Blend roasted squash with brown butter, cheeses, nutmeg, salt, and pepper until creamy. Refrigerate the filling.
Roll out pasta dough, cut into squares, and fill with squash mixture. Seal and shape tortelli.
Cook Brussels sprouts in butter until golden and slightly crispy. Set aside.
Boil tortelli, toss with reserved brown butter, and plate with Brussels sprouts and balsamic reduction.

recipe.name: No-Noodle Eggplant Lasagna with Mushroom Rag√∫
recipe.description: A rich and creamy lasagna featuring roasted eggplant layers, hearty mushroom rag√∫, and b√©chamel sauce. A satisfying gluten-free and meatless main dish.

ingredients.ingredient_name: fresh mushrooms, finely chopped (shiitake and cremini preferred)

steps: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F. Slice eggplants lengthwise into ¬Ω-inch slices. Sprinkle with kosher salt and let sit for 30 minutes. Pat dry with paper towels.
Brush eggplant slices with olive oil and arrange on baking sheets. Roast for 25-30 minutes until lightly browned and tender. Set aside.
In a large pot, heat ¬º cup olive oil over medium heat. Add mushrooms, onion, and carrot, cooking until softened, about 8 minutes.
Stir in garlic and tomato paste, cooking for 2 minutes. Add crushed tomatoes, water, thyme, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 30-40 minutes until thickened.
In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually whisk in milk, stirring constantly, until thickened. Season with salt and nutmeg.
Spread a thin layer of mushroom rag√∫ in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Layer roasted eggplant slices, b√©chamel, and rag√∫. Repeat layers, finishing with b√©chamel and shredded mozzarella.
Bake at 375¬∞F for 40-45 minutes, until bubbling and golden. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

recipe.name: Beet & Chickpea Cakes With Tzatziki
recipe.description: Savory, earthy cakes made with chickpeas and beets, baked to perfection and served with a refreshing, garlicky tzatziki sauce. Perfect as a main or tucked into warm pita with fresh veggies.

ingredients.ingredient_name: extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for brushing
cooked chickpeas (or two 15-ounce cans, drained and rinsed)

steps: Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Line a sheet pan with parchment paper and lightly brush with olive oil.
Place the chickpeas in a bowl and crush with a potato masher, leaving the mixture slightly chunky.
Warm 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a wide skillet over medium heat. Add onions and saut√© for 5 minutes until beginning to brown. Add garlic and salt, cooking for another 3‚Äì4 minutes.
Stir in grated beets and cook for 6‚Äì8 minutes until softened. Add balsamic vinegar, mix well, and remove from heat.
Combine the mashed chickpeas, onion-beet mixture, and chopped dill. Season with additional salt and black pepper as needed.
Use an oiled ‚Öì-cup measure to shape the mixture into cakes. Place on the prepared sheet pan and brush the tops and sides with olive oil.
Bake for 15 minutes. Rotate the tray and bake for another 10‚Äì15 minutes until browned on the bottom.
Let cakes cool for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with tzatziki.

recipe.name: Beetroot Risotto With Goat Cheese
recipe.description: A luxurious and vibrant risotto featuring earthy roasted beets, creamy goat cheese, and a splash of ros√© wine for a hint of brightness.
steps: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F. Toss the chopped beets with olive oil, salt, and pepper, and roast on a sheet pan until tender, about 25‚Äì30 minutes. Let cool slightly.
In a small saucepan, bring the stock to a simmer and keep warm over low heat.
In a large, wide-bottomed pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add minced shallots and saut√© until translucent, about 2 minutes.
Add the Arborio rice and stir to coat the grains in butter. Pour in the ros√© wine, stirring constantly until it reduces and the alcohol evaporates.

Lower the heat and ladle in the warm stock, one or two ladlefuls at a time, stirring constantly and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding the next. Continue until the rice is al dente, about 18‚Äì20 minutes.
Meanwhile, puree the roasted beets with sour cream in a blender until smooth.
When the risotto is cooked to your liking, stir in the beet-sour cream puree. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with chunks of goat cheese and chopped chives.

recipe.name: Broccoli, White Bean & Cheddar Bake
recipe.description: A comforting one-skillet dinner combining caramelized tomato paste, broccoli, white beans, and melty cheddar cheese. Perfect with crusty bread for sopping up the delicious sauce.

ingredients.ingredient_name: anchovies, minced and smashed into a paste

steps: Preheat oven to 425¬∞F.
In a 12-inch ovenproof skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add onion with a pinch of salt and black pepper. Saut√© for 6‚Äì8 minutes until golden.
Stir in anchovies and garlic, cooking for 1 minute. Add tomato paste and stir for 30 seconds, lowering the heat to avoid burning.
Add broccoli and stir to coat in tomato paste. Cook for 3 minutes until broccoli softens slightly. Add stock, white beans, lemon zest, and red wine vinegar. Simmer for 2 minutes.
Sprinkle shredded cheddar over the mixture and transfer the skillet to the oven. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes until cheese is browned and bubbly. Serve warm with crusty bread.

recipe.name: Baked Eggs with Mushrooms and Gruyere
recipe.description: A rich and comforting dish of eggs baked with saut√©ed mushrooms, cream, and Gruyere cheese, creating a perfect balance of creamy and savory flavors.
steps: Preheat the oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C).
Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat, then add the mushrooms and saut√© until soft and browned, about 5-7 minutes.
Stir in the heavy cream and cook for another 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
Crack the eggs into small ramekins or a baking dish.
Spoon the mushroom mixture evenly over the eggs.
Sprinkle the grated Gruyere cheese on top.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the eggs are set but still soft in the center.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste, and garnish with thyme before serving.

recipe.name: Black Pepper Popovers with Chives and Parmesan
recipe.description: Delicate and savory popovers infused with fresh chives, Parmesan cheese, and a hint of black pepper, perfect for any meal.
steps: Heat the oven to 450¬∞F. Lightly coat a 12-cup popover pan or muffin tin with melted butter or oil.
Whisk together the milk, eggs, and melted butter in a large bowl until blended. Add the flour, salt, black pepper, Parmesan cheese, chives, and lemon zest; mix well.

Place the empty pan in the oven to heat for 7 minutes. Carefully remove from the oven and fill the cups evenly with the batter (transferring the batter to a 4-cup liquid measuring cup can make this less messy).
Bake for 18-20 minutes, then lower the oven temperature to 350¬∞F. Continue baking until the popovers are deep golden brown, about 15-18 more minutes.
Cool briefly in the pan before removing and serving. To reheat cooled popovers, place them in a 350¬∞F oven for about 5 minutes.

recipe.name: Andrew Feinberg's Slow-Baked Broccoli Frittata
recipe.description: A custardy and creamy frittata featuring roasted broccoli and a gentle, slow-bake method for a tender texture.
steps: Heat the oven to 400¬∞F. In a large bowl, whisk the eggs, cheese, 1 teaspoon of the salt, and the black pepper; set aside.

Trim ¬Ω inch off the stem of the broccoli. Using a knife, separate all the florets from the base, leaving the stem attached. Cut the florets in half (you can cut any especially large ones into quarters so all are evenly sized).

In a 10- to 11-inch oven-safe saut√© pan over medium-high heat, warm ¬º cup of the oil. Cook the broccoli, mostly undisturbed to develop a nice brown color on one side, then turn and season with salt. Transfer the pan to the oven and roast for 10 to 15 minutes, until tender.

In another 10- to 11-inch saut√© pan over medium-high heat, warm 2 tablespoons of the oil. Add the onions, season with salt, and cook, stirring occasionally, for 3 to 5 minutes, until lightly browned.
Once the broccoli is roasted, return the pan to the stovetop and reduce the oven temperature to 300¬∞F.

Heat the broccoli over medium heat, then add the garlic, red pepper flakes, and 1 tablespoon of the oil. Carefully cook, stirring occasionally, for 1 minute, so as not to burn the garlic. Add the onions to the broccoli and mix well to combine. Add the egg mixture, increase the heat to high, and cook for 30 seconds.

Transfer the pan to the oven and bake for 25 to 30 minutes, until the eggs are just set. Using a rubber spatula, turn out the frittata onto a serving plate. Squeeze the lemon juice over the top, drizzle with oil, and sprinkle with Parmigiano Reggiano.

recipe.name: Cinnamon Sugar Breakfast Puffs
recipe.description: A delightful hybrid of spice cake, muffins, and cinnamon sugar donut holes, offering a cakey and light texture with crisp edges and a crunchy cinnamon sugar coating.
steps: In a heavy-bottomed pan, heat the 1/3 cup butter over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, until browned and nutty smelling. Pour into a mixing bowl and allow to cool completely to room temperature.
Preheat your oven to 350¬∞F. Grease and lightly flour a 12-cup muffin tin.
Add the sugar and egg to the cooled butter. Beat with an electric mixer until all creamed together, lightened in color, and fluffy (about 5 minutes).
In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, salt, spices, and orange zest.
Add the dry ingredients in increments to the butter-sugar mixture, alternating with the milk and beating until fully combined after each addition.
Divide the batter evenly into the cups of the muffin tin. Bake until golden brown and fragrant, about 20-25 minutes.
While the puffs are baking, put the melted butter in one shallow bowl and combine the sugar and cinnamon in another.

When the puffs come out of the oven, use a knife to gently pop them all out of the muffin tin. One by one, dip each puff in the melted butter‚Äîget it all over it‚Äîthen roll it in the cinnamon sugar. Transfer to a serving platter and continue until all puffs are coated. Serve warm.

recipe.name: Spanish-ish Tortilla in Cast Iron
recipe.description: A hearty Spanish-inspired tortilla combining potatoes and onions, cooked in a cast-iron skillet and finished with a sprinkle of Parmesan cheese.

ingredients.ingredient_name: White or Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled

steps: Place the potatoes in a medium pot. Cover with water, season with about a tablespoon of salt, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until the potatoes are just tender when prodded with a fork, 20 to 25 minutes. Drain and let cool, then cut into 1/8-inch slices and put them in a large mixing bowl.

Heat the oven to 400¬∞F. Warm 1 1/2 tablespoons oil in a medium pan over medium heat. Add the onions, season with salt, and cook until translucent and lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Scrape the onions into the bowl with the potatoes.

Lightly whisk the eggs until smooth, then add them to the potatoes and onions, and gently fold everything together. The potatoes should not be sticking together‚Äîmake sure the egg separates each slice. Season with salt and pepper and fold once more.

Set a large nonstick or well-seasoned cast-iron pan over medium-high heat. Add the remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons oil and the butter. When the butter foams, pour in the potato-and-egg mixture and pat it down so it's even on the top. Sprinkle the cheese on top, let the eggs set around the edges, and transfer the pan to the oven. Bake until the eggs are almost set in the middle and the tortilla is browned around the edges, about 20 minutes.

Remove the pan from the oven and let it cool on the stovetop. Run a thin spatula or knife around the edge of the tortilla to loosen it, then invert it onto a plate (this may be a 2-person job). If you'd like to serve the tortilla warm, invert it while it's still warm. Slice and serve. If you'd like to serve it with garlic mayonnaise, I won't argue.

recipe.name: Apricot-Almond Baked Oatmeal
recipe.description: A hearty and wholesome baked oatmeal studded with dried apricots and almonds, perfect for a warm and comforting breakfast.

ingredients.ingredient_name: Butter, divided (2 tablespoons melted, 2 tablespoons room temperature)

steps: Preheat the oven to 350¬∞F and generously butter a 9 x 9-inch baking dish.
In a large bowl, combine the oats, baking powder, cinnamon, ginger, and salt. Stir in the almonds and apricots. Spread the mixture evenly into the prepared baking dish.
In a medium bowl, whisk the milk, cream, honey, 1/4 cup brown sugar, egg, 2 tablespoons melted butter, and vanilla to combine. Pour over the oats.
Dollop with remaining butter and sprinkle with remaining brown sugar.
Bake until the oatmeal has absorbed the liquid and is golden brown on the surface, 25 to 30 minutes. Cool slightly before serving.

recipe.name: Hand-Formed Parmesan Tater Tots
recipe.description: Homemade tater tots made with roasted red potatoes, roasted garlic, and shredded Parmesan cheese, baked to crispy perfection.
steps: Preheat the oven to 425¬∞F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Boil the red potatoes in salted water until tender, about 15 to 20 minutes. Let them cool slightly, then peel and grate them using a box grater.
Combine the grated potatoes, minced roasted garlic, Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Mix gently until combined.
Form the potato mixture into small cylindrical shapes, about 1 inch long, to resemble tater tots.
Place the tater tots on the prepared baking sheet. Lightly brush them with olive oil or use cooking spray.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, turning halfway through, until golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce.

recipe.name: Oven-Roasted Egyptian Mesaka‚Äôa
recipe.description: A simplified and flavorful Egyptian eggplant casserole with roasted eggplant, cinnamon-spiced tomato sauce, and optional ground beef, served with rice or pita bread.

ingredients.ingredient_name: kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
green or red bell peppers, seeded and roughly chopped
beef or chicken stock (or water for vegetarian)
cooked white rice or pita bread

steps: Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F. Slice the eggplants crosswise into 1/4-inch-thick disks and arrange on a sheet pan. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons olive oil and season with salt. Roast for 30‚Äì35 minutes until caramelized.
While eggplant roasts, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Saut√© onion and bell peppers until browned and softened.
Add tomato paste, cinnamon, paprika, cumin, and chili powder (if using). Cook for 2 minutes until the tomato paste darkens slightly.
Add garlic and ground beef (if using). Cook for 1‚Äì2 minutes until the beef begins to brown.
Stir in chopped tomatoes and stock (or water). Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper.
Layer half the roasted eggplant in a 3-quart baking dish. Top with half the sauce, then sprinkle with almonds (if using). Repeat with remaining eggplant and sauce.
Cover with foil and bake for 35 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for 10 more minutes. Serve hot with rice or pita bread.

recipe.name: Meyer Lemon Galette With Saut√©ed Greens, Rainbow Carrots & Sweet Potato Mash
recipe.description: A rustic galette combining sweet potatoes, vibrant greens, and carrots, complemented by a tangy Meyer lemon vinaigrette and a tender, whole-grain crust.

ingredients.ingredient_name: leafy greens (kale, Swiss chard, spinach), coarsely chopped
egg mixed with water (for egg wash)

steps: Prepare saut√©ed greens: Heat olive oil in a pan. Add onions and carrots, cooking until soft. Stir in garlic and greens, seasoning with salt and pepper. Finish with Meyer lemon juice. Set aside.
Boil sweet potatoes until tender. Mash with butter, Meyer lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
Make the galette crust: Mix flours, cornmeal, salt, pepper, and lemon zest in a bowl. Cut in butter until crumbly. Gradually add cold water to form dough. Chill for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 400¬∞F. Roll out dough and transfer to a parchment-lined baking sheet. Spread mashed sweet potatoes in the center, leaving a border. Layer greens and carrots on top.
Fold edges of the dough over the filling, brush with egg wash, and place lemon slices on top. Bake for 45‚Äì50 minutes, until golden brown. Serve with grated Parmigiano-Reggiano.

recipe.name: Vegetarian French Onion Soup With Asparagus & Cheesy Croutons
recipe.description: A lighter take on French onion soup featuring deeply caramelized onions, tangy vermouth, fresh asparagus, and cheesy croutons for a spring-inspired twist on the classic.

ingredients.ingredient_name: dry vermouth (or white wine vinegar with water)
vegan Worcestershire sauce or soy sauce (optional)
crusty bread, torn into 1- to 2-inch pieces
asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces

steps: Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions, salt, and pepper. Cook, stirring every 5 minutes, until onions are deeply caramelized, about 40‚Äì50 minutes. Scrape the bottom of the pot occasionally and add a splash of water if needed.
Stir in vermouth and cook for 2 minutes. Add Worcestershire sauce and 8 cups water. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer for 20 minutes. Season with additional salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 375¬∞F. Toss bread pieces with 1 tablespoon olive oil, salt, and pepper. Bake for 15‚Äì20 minutes until crispy. Sprinkle cheese over croutons and bake for an additional 2‚Äì3 minutes until melted.
Just before serving, stir asparagus into the soup and cook until bright green, about 2 minutes.
Ladle soup into bowls and top with cheesy croutons. Garnish with black pepper.
